pr_title: Add progress counts for more job types

timeline.message: Add progress counts for more job types
Add progress counts for more job types

timeline.author: bbpennel

timeline.message:
* Set totalClicks earlier
* Add TransferBinariesToStorageJob counts

* Set totalClicks earlier
* Add TransferBinariesToStorageJob counts

timeline.bodyText: Hmm, with this approach the total count will shrink if you resume the job. It may be easiest to switch the count to be the number of objects being processed rather than the number of files. In that case you should be able to precompute the total (I believe counting the total number of subjects in the model will get you this), and the counts will be in line with most of the other jobs
timeline.author: bbpennel

timeline.message: Use subject counts to get total count

timeline.bodyText: I don't think the click counts will line up with the total anymore, since clicks are still counting number of files while the total is the number of resources. I believe you'll need to move the addClicks call into transferBinaries since that iterates over each resource in the model.
timeline.author: bbpennel

timeline.message: Move counting into the TransferBinaries method

timeline.bodyText: I think you might have to reset the click count between runs, otherwise the count is going to be higher than the total after a resume. Not sure if trying to skip addClick during a resume would be practical, but maybe its possible?
timeline.author: bbpennel

timeline.message: Reset click count if a job is resumed

timeline.author: bbpennel
